title: Rear Wheel - Installation

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle Including locking devices
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Note to be used in service manual with stabilise warning

Observe all torque wrench tightening procedures, refer to
Lubricate the lips of the wheel bearing seals with a smear of multipurpose grease.
Fit the collar to the brake disc side of the wheel.
Fit the spacer to the sprocket side of the wheel.
Position the wheel in between the swinging arm and engage the drive chain with the sprocket.
Make sure the brake caliper mounting plates slot is located on the swinging arm lug.
Lift the wheel into position, making sure the spacer, collar and caliper mounting plate remain correctly positioned.
Insert the spindle from the right hand side.

body.body: If a rear wheel adjuster block is to be replaced, the left and right hand side adjuster blocks must be replaced as a pair.

Failure to replace the rear wheel adjuster blocks as a pair may result in a misalignment of the rear wheel when adjusting the drive chain tension resulting in loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Fit the washer and a new nut to the spindle and hand tighten.
Lower the motorcycle to the ground and adjust the drive chain free movement, see
Operate the brake pedal making sure the brake pads are in firm contact with the disc.
Check the operation of the rear brake. Rectify as necessary.
Warning Brakes - Dangerous to operate with defective brakes
It is dangerous to operate the motorcycle with defective brakes.
The fault must be checked and rectified by a competent person with the specialist knowledge and technical understanding of motorcycles, such as an authorised Triumph dealer.
Failure to follow the advice above may lead to loss of motorcycle control which could result in serious injury or death.
